snippet: General Motors will seek to cut $26 billion in pension obligations through changes in payments to retired white-collar workers.
abstract: General Motors announces that it will offer lump-sum payments to thousands of white-collar retirees to reduce its pension obligations, which are the biggest in the nation; will also pay Prudential Insurance to take over its pension payments to other retirees.

byline.original: By BILL VLASIC and MARY WILLIAMS WALSH

lead_paragraph: General Motors will seek to cut $26 billion in pension obligations through changes in payments to retired white-collar workers.

headline.seo: G.M. to Use Buyouts to Cut Pension Obligations
headline.main: G.M. Plans Big Buyouts for Retirees in Pension
headline.print_headline: G.M. Plans Big Buyouts For Retirees In Pension
